name: Storytelling
description: There are countless ways to tell a story, but how can you use web-native media to tell your story in new ways? Learn and share techniques for amplifying your voice and message on the web.

name: The Future of the Web
description: Debate the ethics and philosophy of technology, and what it means to be a citizen on the web, by exploring how much control we have over our data and how we can use it for the greater good.

name: AR, VR & Machine Learning
description: Who does technology belong to? Where are the boundaries between understood reality and algorithms? Explore the possibilities of machine learning, augmented reality and virtual reality.

name: Digital Inclusion
description: Investigate the issues and blockers that young people, people with mixed abilities, people from different cultures and people who speak different languages face on today's web.

name: Advocacy & Web Literacy
description: Sharpen your digital and web literacy skills so you can teach and credential other people who want to know how to live, learn, and work on the web.

name: Multi-lingual MozFest
description: These multi-lingual sessions will help you connect with a global community working to make the web a more inclusive space for the millions of users who do not speak English.
